body.p: There is no autosave in BTS 3.0. Make sure you save your work in regular intervals to avoid loss of input.
The options for saving your work are:

The program will save your file after switching to a different database object.
You can save manually by clicking or in the toolbar. See Toolbar for more information.
If you do not save your work before leaving the program it will ask you to save after clicking "Exit BTS" or "Restart BTS" (not recommended! Save your work in regular intervals. Otherwise, if BTS or your OS crashes you will lose your data!). This is not reduced to editing texts: Created database objects will be automatically saved but changing any data (including their names etc.) requires manual saving (see options above).
